---
title: "Monty hall problem simulation"
date: "19/10/2019"
---

```{r}
monty_hall<-function(number_trials,strategy){
  game_count <- 0
  win_count <- 0
  status_code <- 200
  
  if (strategy != "switch" & strategy != "stand") {
    "Strategy input can only be switch or stand"
  } else {
  
      for (i in seq(1, number_trials, length = number_trials)){
        
          game_count <- game_count + 1
          winning_door <- sample(1:3, 1)  # selects the index of the winning door
          players_choice <- sample(1:3, 1)  # simulates the player's (random) choice between the three doors
          
          if (strategy == "stand") {
            if (players_choice == winning_door) {
              win_count <- win_count + 1
            }
          } else if (strategy == "switch") {
            if (players_choice != winning_door){
              win_count <- win_count + 1  # if the player's choice was not the winning door, switching induces a win
            }
          }
      }
      
        success_rate = win_count/game_count
        print(success_rate)
    
  }
}

```
